meanings.definition: A person who sets type for printing using a photosetting machine.
meanings.sent1: The photosetters at the printing press work diligently to set the type accurately.
meanings.sent2: The photosetters in the publishing house are skilled at their job.
meanings.sent3: The photosetters decided to have a race to see who could set the type the fastest.
meanings.sent4: The photosetters are like conductors orchestrating the words on the page.
meanings.sent5: The photosetters' precision is crucial for the quality of the printed material.

meanings.definition: A machine used for setting type for printing by means of photographs of characters.
meanings.sent1: The photosetters in the print shop are essential for producing newspapers efficiently.
meanings.sent2: The old photosetters were replaced by digital technology in modern printing.
meanings.sent3: The photosetters in the corner of the room seemed to be whispering to each other.
meanings.sent4: The photosetters hummed softly as they worked, creating a symphony of words.
meanings.sent5: The photosetters gleamed under the fluorescent lights, ready to bring text to life.
